Power has been restored to most of the 150 properties affected earlier A sub-station on Oxford Street East remains out of action affecting a 53 properties Some have had power restored with the use of generators.

If people have any concerns about the smoke’s impact on their health they should call their GP surgery for advice following any instructions for out of hours services or contact the NHS 111 service (which is free from both landlines and mobiles and open 24/7).
People with asthma and other respiratory conditions may be particularly susceptible to the smoke and should carry and use their medication (such as inhalers as usual.

Advice from Public Health England (PHE is for residents in areas affected by the smoke should stay indoors keep their doors and windows closed Motorists who have to travel through the smoke should keep windows closed turn off air conditioning and keep their air vents closed.

Gibson Terrace on Oxford Street East was evacuated earlier when the fire spread to the third building which is in close proximity to Gibson Terrace At one point it looked like more properties would have to be evacuated and Dukinfield Town Hall was opened as a second rest centre.

GMFRS report the fire is under control and is not now expected to spread any further than the three buildings affected so far A substantial present from GMFRS supported by the Forward Incident Officers from Tameside Council remained on site overnight.
The latest on the major fire that broke out in my constituency yesterday 15 fire engines 2 aerial appliances and over 70 firefighters have been onsite tackling the fire since yesterday afternoon.

Finally Roger Godsiff's apology in relation to some of his comments that may have offended people is welcome However he can be left in no doubt after so many MPs spoke so strongly in favour of LGBT inclusive education,we will not be going back in time on this issue only forward

To teach children about relationships and omit the fact that LGBT couples exist is fundamentally discriminatory At a time when levels of homophobic and transphobic hate crime are rising in our society it is more important than ever that we educate young people.

There is not only a moral imperative to teach LGBT inclusive education there is also a legal requirement under the Equality Act which all schools must comply with There is no justifiable reason to stop the teaching of these issues.

The Labour Party has long supported and campaigned for LGBT inclusive education in schools and the achievement of cross Party support for legislation this year was a significant step forward in the struggle for LGBT equality.

Create a fair legal framework through repealing the Lobbying Act which gags charities and community organisations being critical of government replacing it with a new Community Empowerment Charter based in law that empowers civil society organisations.
This will allow communities to bid to take control of buildings or other assets in their neighbourhood that are neglected with funding to match from the Community Innovation Fund.
In recognising the importance of places we belong to community anchor organisations will be promoted by local authorities and a new Public Right to Control policy.
Increased grant funding for smaller organisations and charities with collaborative decision-making in public procurement promoting community wealth building and local employment.
